speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: SCENE VI. The same.

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: Enter GRATIANO and SALARINO, masqued

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: This is the pent-house under which Lorenzo

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Desired us to make stand.

speaker: SALARINO
text_entry: His hour is almost past.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: And it is marvel he out-dwells his hour,

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: For lovers ever run before the clock.

speaker: SALARINO
text_entry: O, ten times faster Venus' pigeons fly

speaker: SALARINO
text_entry: To seal love's bonds new-made, than they are wont

speaker: SALARINO
text_entry: To keep obliged faith unforfeited!

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: That ever holds: who riseth from a feast

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: With that keen appetite that he sits down?

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Where is the horse that doth untread again

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: His tedious measures with the unbated fire

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: That he did pace them first? All things that are,

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Are with more spirit chased than enjoy'd.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: How like a younker or a prodigal

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: The scarfed bark puts from her native bay,

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Hugg'd and embraced by the strumpet wind!

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: How like the prodigal doth she return,

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: With over-weather'd ribs and ragged sails,

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Lean, rent and beggar'd by the strumpet wind!

speaker: SALARINO
text_entry: Here comes Lorenzo: more of this hereafter.

speaker: SALARINO
text_entry: Enter LORENZO

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Sweet friends, your patience for my long abode;

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Not I, but my affairs, have made you wait:

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: When you shall please to play the thieves for wives,

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: I'll watch as long for you then. Approach;

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Here dwells my father Jew. Ho! who's within?

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Enter JESSICA, above, in boy's clothes

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: Who are you? Tell me, for more certainty,

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: Albeit I'll swear that I do know your tongue.

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Lorenzo, and thy love.

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: Lorenzo, certain, and my love indeed,

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: For who love I so much? And now who knows

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: But you, Lorenzo, whether I am yours?

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Heaven and thy thoughts are witness that thou art.

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: Here, catch this casket; it is worth the pains.

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: I am glad 'tis night, you do not look on me,

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: For I am much ashamed of my exchange:

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: But love is blind and lovers cannot see

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: The pretty follies that themselves commit;

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: For if they could, Cupid himself would blush

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: To see me thus transformed to a boy.

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Descend, for you must be my torchbearer.

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: What, must I hold a candle to my shames?

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: They in themselves, good-sooth, are too too light.

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: Why, 'tis an office of discovery, love;

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: And I should be obscured.

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: So are you, sweet,

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Even in the lovely garnish of a boy.

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: But come at once;

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: For the close night doth play the runaway,

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: And we are stay'd for at Bassanio's feast.

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: I will make fast the doors, and gild myself

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: With some more ducats, and be with you straight.

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: Exit above

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Now, by my hood, a Gentile and no Jew.

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Beshrew me but I love her heartily;

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: For she is wise, if I can judge of her,

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: And fair she is, if that mine eyes be true,

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: And true she is, as she hath proved herself,

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: And therefore, like herself, wise, fair and true,

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Shall she be placed in my constant soul.

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Enter JESSICA, below

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: What, art thou come? On, gentlemen; away!

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Our masquing mates by this time for us stay.

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Exit with Jessica and Salarino

speaker: LORENZO
text_entry: Enter ANTONIO

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Who's there?

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Signior Antonio!

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Fie, fie, Gratiano! where are all the rest?

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: 'Tis nine o'clock: our friends all stay for you.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: No masque to-night: the wind is come about;

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Bassanio presently will go aboard:

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: I have sent twenty out to seek for you.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: I am glad on't: I desire no more delight

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Than to be under sail and gone to-night.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Exeunt
